Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libteam
exit 0

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libteam
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libteam bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The libteam packages contain a library which is a user-space counterpart for the team network driver. The libteam library also provides an API to control team network devices. The libteam packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.15, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version, including documentation for the doxygen documenting tool. (BZ#1116970, BZ#1125296) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, the team daemon did not restart and could not fail over. This update makes sure that teamd is always running unless the user requests the systemd daemon to stop it. As a result, teamd automatically restarts if terminated unexpectedly, a teamd instance takes over. (BZ#1072855) Previously, when the user created a team device using initscripts and removed the device by the ip command, the teamd daemon kept running unaware that the device it controlled had already been removed. With this update, teamd detects the removal and quits as expected. (BZ#1082551) Due to a regression, when using take-over mode, it was impossible to remove a port using control interface, for example teamdctl. As a consequence, the ip utility returned an error. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the aforementioned error is no longer returned. (BZ#1085938) Prior to this update, Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP) active runner was incorrectly selecting incorrect aggregator on port activation. As a consequence, the link of current active port was dropped. This update fixes LACP aggregator behavior, and the selection process now proceeds correctly. (BZ#1089256) Previously, the actor "system" value was set to a MAC address which was afterwards set to the team device during the team initialization. If that was changed later on, the teamd daemon sent Link Aggregation Control Protocol Data Units (LACPDUs) with the old MAC. An upstream patch has been backported to fix this bug, and teamd now sends only correct MAC addresses. (BZ#1090578) When downing or reactivating a connection in NetworkManager, the teamd instance managing the link terminated unexpectedly. As a consequence, the whole process group was terminated. The underlying source code has been patched, and pgroup no longer crashes in the described scenario. (BZ#1160615) The teamd daemon writes messages to standard errors, depending on the verbosity level. However, writing to a closed standard error caused the SIGPIPE signal to be returned, which consequently terminated teamd. With this update, teamd ignores SIGPIPE, thus fixing this bug. (BZ#1173632) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, the ifup-eth and ifdown-eth scripts are able to use the ifup and ifdown scripts, so that the teamd initscripts can be executed directly from ifup-eth and ifdown-eth. (BZ#1082522) This update adds the "debug_level" configuration option, so now it is possible to obtain more verbose logs for troubleshooting purposes. (BZ#1086383) This update adds the missing security-related compile-time flags, PIE and full RELRO, to the libteam packages. These flags bring security benefits for long-running executables, and thus are required to be used for daemons in Red Hat Enterprise Linux. (BZ#1092549) Users of libteam are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
